channel.title: Comments on: Friday Go Forward: Week 62

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Great point man! I think my natural style is to actually play thickly and use it for control of the match, so I'll certainly be glad to return to that soon. Thanks for the advice man!
item.content:encoded: Great point man! I think my natural style is to actually play thickly and use it for control of the match, so I’ll certainly be glad to return to that soon. Thanks for the advice man!

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: I like the idea of playing more for territory than for influence myself, and I think this change in play style coupled with an increase in the frequency of your playing will be really helpful. I think, however, that it might be worth trying in a month or two to start trying to play thickly. I heard somewhere that pros play thickly because through an abundance of strength on the board they'll be able to control the match. Might be something worth trying.
item.content:encoded: I like the idea of playing more for territory than for influence myself, and I think this change in play style coupled with an increase in the frequency of your playing will be really helpful. I think, however, that it might be worth trying in a month or two to start trying to play thickly. I heard somewhere that pros play thickly because through an abundance of strength on the board they’ll be able to control the match. Might be something worth trying.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Haha. Clearly I need to write more clearly! It's update again. Hopefully that is easier to understand!
item.content:encoded: Haha. Clearly I need to write more clearly! It’s update again. Hopefully that is easier to understand!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Hey Marek. That was a typo. My mistake. I fixed it now. Does it make more sense now?

item.title: By: Marek Jasovsky
item.dc:creator: Marek Jasovsky
item.description: Again language troubles at my side with the lessons learned. don't become overconfident, rather give your opponent chance?` or don't give your opponent a chance to turn it around by being overconfident? do you native people also have such troubles understanding this correctly? ;)
item.content:encoded:
Again language troubles at my side with the lessons learned. don’t become overconfident, rather give your opponent chance?`
or don’t give your opponent a chance to turn it around by being overconfident? do you native people also have such troubles understanding this correctly? ðŸ˜‰
